intro: Polemonium carneum f. luteum, commonly known as the yellow cardinal flower, is a strikingly colorful variant of the cardinal flower species. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow petals, which contrast sharply with its dark green foliage. This plant belongs to the Polemonium genus, which is part of the Boraginaceae family, known for its showy flowers and medicinal uses. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. The plant's unique coloration makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking to add visual interest to shaded landscapes.
